Flame simulations can now be done with Cantera in Matlab, including
burner-stabilized premixed flames, stagnation-point premixed flames
at a surface, and stagnation-point flames (premixed or non-premixed)
between two
opposed jets. 

As an example, some plots for a non-premixed ethane/air flame
computed using GRI-Mech 3.0 are shown at http://bl
ue.caltech.edu/c2h6.pdf  This
solution on a final grid of 180 points took about 3 minutes on a G4
Powerbook 
laptop, starting from a very poor initial guess.

Although it is working, I haven't had time to clean up the code, so I
am not officially releasing it yet.  But for those who are brave of
heart, you can
check out the latest version from the CVS server at the Sourceforge
site. Build and
install everything as usual, then in Matlab add both the Cantera
toolbox directory to 
the path, as well as the 1D subdirectory within it. The m-file that
solves the 
nonpremixed flame in the figure is 'flame2.m' in the 'cantera-demos'
directory.

I will be gone on vacation for 2 weeks starting tomorrow, and will
not be in email contact at all during this time. The official
release will have to wait until later this month...


Dave
